node.title: What will fully vaccinated travellers need to do to enter Queensland?
node.alt: A road sign at the Queensland-New South Wales border on the Gold Coast
node.description: In 15 days, Queensland will move one step closer to reopening its borders to interstate hotspots, but just how easy will it be to actually enter the state and what requirements will travellers need?
node.content:
["In 15 days, Queensland will move one step closer to reopening its borders to interstate hotspots, but\u00a0just how easy will it be to actually enter the state and what requirements will travellers need?", "Here's what we know so far:", "
What will happen when we hit 70 per cent?
", "In just over two weeks on Friday, November 19, the state is expected to have 70 per cent of eligible Queenslanders aged 16 and over fully vaccinated.", "This will trigger\u00a0the first round of change to come into effect, after Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk announced her border plan last month.", "Travellers from hotspots will only be allowed to enter the state by air, must be fully vaccinated, must test negative to COVID-19 within the previous 72 hours and must complete 14 days of home quarantine.", "
What about 80 per cent?
", "This is due to happen on Friday, December 17\u00a0\u2014 and is the date most interstate travellers have bookmarked.", "That's because it'll be much easier to enter Queensland.", "For the first time in months, you will be able to enter the state from a hotspot by road\u00a0as well as by air, you must be fully vaccinated and test negative to COVID-19 within the previous 72 hours.", "But the big change:\u00a0quarantine won't be required.", "So if you've been to a declared hotspot, you can enter the state as long as you follow the above requirements.", "However, authorities are still trying to work out just how the process will work at the border checkpoints.", "Health Minister Yvette D'Ath said Queensland Health is working with police on how to operationalise the process.", "\"It's going to be important that we still have a system where we can be confident that the cars coming across the border\u00a0are meeting that requirement and have the valid pass, so we're just working through with the police what that looks like,\" she said.", "\"I get that there's going to be thousands and thousands of cars going back and across the border every single day once we hit that 80 per cent mark, so we want to make sure the cars can flow.", "\"Life will become a lot easier for a lot of people when we hit that 80 per cent mark.\"", "", "
Ms D'Ath said\u00a0Queensland Health was working with police on how to operationalise the border process.(ABC News: Alice Pavlovic)
", "
What will I need to show to enter the state?
", "That too is also being worked through at the moment, but authorities hinted today they're trying to streamline the process.", "Ms D'Ath said authorities were updating the border pass system now so people would be able to upload their vaccination status.", "\"They'll be able to upload their negative test results\u00a0\u2026 so that will be really important because that will mean that the moment that border pass is issued that's verification that they've met those two criteria,\" Ms D'Ath said.", "\"So it's really just about showing the border pass \u2026 not having to show the documents that sit behind that.\"", "
When will the border checkpoints end?
", "No date has been locked in yet, but at this stage border checkpoints will remain until we hit 90 per cent of Queenslanders being fully vaccinated.", "Last week, Deputy Premier Steven Miles said the physical border barriers to other states will be removed at this point.", "\"It's very hard to predict the 90 per cent threshold. Some jurisdictions see a tapering off [of vaccinations] at 80 per cent \u2026 you can't just use a straight current daily rate,\" Mr Miles said.", "\"We've always sought to minimise the impact on people, while also keeping people safe.", "Unvaccinated travellers will still need to meet requirements for entry and will need to undertake quarantine.", "
What are the rules for international travellers?
", "When we hit the 70 per cent\u00a0threshold, overseas arrivals will have to continue doing 14 days of mandatory hotel quarantine.", "But once we hit 80 per cent, it become easier for fully vaccinated travellers.", "If you test negative within 72 hours of travelling back to Queensland from overseas, you can bypass hotel quarantine and complete the period at home.", "", "
Outbreak: How Australia lost control of the Delta variant
"]
